intro: Burmeistera succulenta var. meiophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf burmeistera, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features fleshy, ovate leaves that are typically a vibrant green with a waxy texture. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, often blooming in the spring. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires moderate sunlight. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
